title.narrative: EC Manta Public Services Improvement Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to support the Municipality of Manta in increasing the quality and sustainability of public services for water, sanitation and urban mobility.The objective will be achieved by (i) increasing availability of water supply and efficiency of water and sewerage services; (ii) improving urban mobility and accessibility through improvements to the street network, including sidewalks; and (iii) enhancing the capacity of the municipal government in planning and managing the provision ofwater and sanitation and urban transport services.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Operational Manual | Description :The Borrower shall carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions ofthe Operational Manual, which shall include, inter alia: (i) environmental guidelines for small works under Part III.1 (d) of theProject, including procedures for any potential environmental negative impact of the construction of a small laboratory; and (ii)the recommendations of the Poza Honda Dam Study. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Unit | Description :The Borrower shall establish and thereafter operate and maintainthroughout the implementation of the Project, a Project implementation unit (“UGP”), with functions, staffing and responsibilitiessatisfactory to the Bank, and set forth in the Operational Manual. | Due Date :19-Aug-2014
Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :The Borrower shall carry out the Project in accordance with the EMPs, the RAP, andRPF. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Specialists | Description :No later than two months after the Effective Date, the Borrower shall hire: (i) aprocurement specialist; (ii) an environmental specialist; (iii) a social specialist; and (iv) a financial management specialist,all under terms of reference approved by the Bank, to carry out the duties and responsibilities specified in the OperationalManual. | Due Date :17-Oct-2014

Finance Agreement :Subsidiary Agreement | Description :For purposes of the carrying out of Parts I and III.1 of the Project, theBorrower shall enter into an agreement (“Subsidiary Agreement”) with EPAM, under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank. |Due Date :31-Jan-2014The restructuring requires an amendment.

Finance Agreement: Safeguards for Technical Assistance | Description :For technical assistance for the preparation of a waterresources integrated management plan under Part III.1 (e) of the Project, the Borrower, through the UGP, shall ensure that the ToRsshall duly incorporate the requirements of the applicable Safeguard Policies, then in force, as applied to the advice conveyedthrough such technical assistance. | Due Date :30-Jun-2018

title.narrative: Household sewerage connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project
Implementation and adoption of a road data management system
Number of water utilities that the project is supporting
Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project
Number of water connections activated under the Project
Number of people provided with paved access to their houses in lower-income neighborhoods
New household sewer connections constructed under the project
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention
Number of km of quality cycle infrastructure implemented
Travel time in public transport along Par Vial
Preparation of an Urban Mobility Plan
Commercial system in EPAM updated and operational
Emergency repair works, including the hydraulic isolation of Tarqui Zone carried out
Two replaced pumping systems for the Caza Lagarto and Ceibal water treatment plants operational
